div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1814 Gombad, near Gorgan, in anc. Hyr- cania, c. 1955 Burial: before c. 53 B.C. (Le Rider) Contents: c. 13,000 AR Antiochus IV: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Demetrius II, 1st reign: 4 tetradr. (Se- leuceia ad Tigrim) Antiochus VII: 11 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Antiochus VIII: 89 tetradr. (Antiocheia 84, Damascus 5) Antiochus IX; 16 tetradr. (Antiocheia 14, Damascus 2) Antiochus X: 86 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Seleucus VI: 19 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Philip Philadelphus: 11 tetradr. (An- tiocheia) Kamnaskires and Anzaze, Elymaïs: 1 tetradr. Mithradates I, Parthia: 1+ tetradr. (Se- leuceia ad Tigrim as Sellwood 13/4) c. 71+ dr. (Ecba- tana 1+ as Sellwood 12/2; unc. mints c. 70, as Sellwood 8-10 [c. 20], 11 [c. 50]) Phraates II: c. 50 dr. (unc. mints as Sell- wood 16) Artabanus I: c. 50 dr. (unc. mints as Sell- wood 19-20) Mithradates II: c. 25 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim, as Sellwood 24 [c. 20], 32 [3-4]) C. 200 dr. (unc. mints as Sellwood 24-9) "Gotarzes I": c. 200 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim as Sellwood 30) "thousands" of dr. (unc. mints as Sellwood 30 [c. 20 with district names]) Sinatruces: c. 40 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim as Sellwood 31) "thousands" of dr. (unc. mints as Sellwood 31) Phraates III: 1+ tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim as Sellwood 39) c. 200 dr. (unc. mints as Sellwood 33-4, 38-9) Mithradates III: "some" dr. (unc. mints as Sellwood 35) Orodes II: 3+ tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim, as Sellwood 36 [2], 37 [1]) "some" dr. (unc. mints as Sell- wood 36) Disposition: Copenhagen 2 Seleucid, 24 Parthian (SNGCop. 1, 8-9, 22, 25, 28, 34, 36, 44, 52, 56-63, 68, 75-6, 80-1, 83; 23, 53-4, 64 may also derive from the hoard); B. Simonetta 15 Parthian Le Rider, Suse, p. 394, note 2; p. 444, note 3 Simonetta, NC 1966, pp. 29-30 Mørkholm, INJ (1965-6, publ. 1970), p. 12 The burial date is based on the observation that apparently no coins of Orodes II with the title "King of Kings" were included. The Seleucid coins totalled c. 400, while the Parthians comprised c. 300 tetradr. and 12,000 dr. All figures should be regarded with utmost caution. Part of the hd. was melted down
